subject: Re: Chris Moon/Frank's Box on YouTube
author: immortallic2
full_text:
I personally have seen Chris use his box in public forum four times.  
I have heard the box give audible yes and no type answers to peoples 
questions.  I do feel though that the ones that get emotionally moved 
the most are the ones wanting with all their heart to hear from a 
loved one.  When these people get an answer that may or may not be 
heard by all, they feel that it is indeed from a loved one and it 
hits them in the heart as if it was real.  I would love to hear a 
recorded session from start to finish as an investigator.  After all 
this research is for all not just "30"....  :-)

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
>
> Robin-- I have watched this clip and it is the least convincing of  
> all the ones I have seen of him with the box. I have heard several  
> where some of the audio is clear enough to stand on its own 
without  
> his interpretation, and where his interpretation generally agrees. 
I  
> have also heard some where the audio I hear disagrees with his  
> interpretation, but not to such a high degree that I was overtly  
> troubled by it--it was in what I would call the high-end of my  
> tolerance range for subjectivity.  I have heard audio where the  
> person asking questions of the box clearly heard answered that  
> appeared to move them greatly without dependance on Chris's  
> interpretation.
> 
> So, to try to sum up for you, my personal investigation led me to  
> believe that something was happening with the box. I did not 
always  
> agree with Chris's interpretation, but it appeared the same or 
close  
> to what I heard a high enough percentage of the time that I was  
> willing to accept he was not faking it, but giving it an honest  
> enough go. It led me to start hounding Frank for a box of my own, 
and  
> later to buy a minibox from Rick, since poor Frank was beset on 
all  
> sides. ;)
> 
> We've already had some spectacularly burning arguments about what  
> Chris claims his guides or technicians tell him behind closed 
doors.  
> As far as I know, no audio of this is public, so his claims can't 
be  
> evaluated. I think the proliferation of people getting results 
with  
> the boxes belies his assertion that only 30 are chosen.
> 
> Ann
> 
>
